node.title: Marie Antoinette's diamond bracelets sell for millions at auction
node.alt: A woman holds up diamond bracelets in each hand.
node.description: The opulent bracelets, among the rare pieces of jewellery from the ill-fated French royal that are still up for public sale today, went under the hammer at a Christie's auction in Geneva.
node.content:
["A pair of diamond bracelets that once belonged to Marie Antoinette have been sold\u00a0at auction for 7.46 million Swiss francs ($11.1 million), several times the pre-sale estimate.", "The opulent bracelets, among the rare pieces of jewellery from the ill-fated French royal that are still up for public sale today, went under the hammer at a Christie's auction in Geneva.", "The bracelets each\u00a0feature 112 diamonds and include silver and gold.", "Rahul Kadakia, Christie's international director of jewellery, who conducted the auction, told the Geneva saleroom that the bracelets had been with the same family for almost 200 years.", "The buyer was bidding by telephone and not identified.", "The hammer price was 6.2 million Swiss francs ($9.3 million)\u00a0but with commission the final price was 7.46 million Swiss francs ($11.1 million), Christie's spokesperson Alexandra Kindermann said.", "", "
Marie Antoinette spirited a chest of jewels out of France before her execution.(Keystone via AP: Martial Trezzini)
", "Marie Antoinette was the wife of King Louis XVI, who was deposed during the French Revolution.", "Before she was\u00a0guillotined in 1793. she\u00a0sent a\u00a0letter from prison in the Tuileries in Paris saying that a wooden chest with jewels would be sent for safekeeping.", "Her surviving daughter Marie Therese\u00a0received the jewels when she was in Austria, the auction house said.", "The\u00a0bracelets had been expected to fetch $3 million to $6 million, Christie's said before the sale.", "Rival auction houses will be putting other memorabilia\u00a0under the hammer this week.", "On Wednesday in Geneva, Sotheby's is set to auction a 26.8-carat oval sapphire surrounded by diamonds, and matching ear clips, that once belonged to Grand Duchess Maria Pavlovna of Russia.", "The pieces were whisked out of Russia during the country's 1917 revolution.", "The pieces are\u00a0expected to garner as much as 480,000 Swiss francs ($714,400).", "On Thursday, Sotheby's will auction a pair of high-top Nike sneakers from Kobe Bryant, the Los Angeles Lakers star\u00a0who died in a helicopter crash in California last year.", "The basketball shoes are expected to fetch up to 35,000 Swiss francs ($52,000).", "Bryant wore the sneakers in a March 17, 2004, victory over the LA Clippers, according to Sotheby's."]
